Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Systems/products/services that process data are inventoried.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Maintain a comprehensive inventory of all systems, products, and services that process data to enhance organizational understanding and management of privacy risks associated with data processing, thereby supporting informed privacy risk management decisions.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Owners or operators (e.g., the organization or third parties such as service providers, partners, customers, and developers) and their roles with respect to the systems/products/services and components (e.g., internal or external) that process data are inventoried.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Maintain a comprehensive inventory of all owners or operators, including the organization and any third parties such as service providers, partners, customers, and developers, along with their specific roles related to the systems, products, or services and components, whether internal or external, that process data. This inventory supports the organizational understanding necessary to manage privacy risks to individuals arising from data processing activities.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Categories of individuals (e.g., customers, employees or prospective employees, consumers) whose data are being processed are inventoried.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Maintain an inventory of categories of individuals (e.g., customers, employees, or prospective employees, consumers) whose data are processed, to enhance organizational understanding and management of privacy risks associated with data processing activities. This inventory supports the objective of developing organizational insights into how data processing by systems, products, or services impacts privacy risk.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Data actions of the systems/products/services are inventoried.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des:
**Contextualized Framework Requirement:**
Ensure a comprehensive inventory of data actions performed by the organization's systems, products, and services is maintained to enhance the understanding of data processing activities. This inventory supports the management of privacy risks associated with the processing of individual's data, aligning with organizational objectives to manage privacy implications effectively.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: The purposes for the data actions are inventoried.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Inventory the purposes of data actions to enhance organizational understanding and management of privacy risks associated with data processing in systems, products, or services.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Data elements within the data actions are inventoried.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Inventory all data elements involved in data processing activities to enhance organizational understanding and management of privacy risks associated with individuals' data, in alignment with the objective of developing comprehensive privacy risk management strategies.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: The data processing environment is identified (e.g., geographic location, internal, cloud, third parties).
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure the identification of the data processing environment—including geographic location and whether processing is internal, in the cloud, or involves third parties—to enhance organizational understanding and management of privacy risks associated with individuals' data processed by systems, products, or services.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: Data processing by systems, products, or services is understood and informs the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Data processing is mapped, illustrating the data actions and associated data elements for systems/products/services, including components; roles of the component owners/operators; and interactions of individuals or third parties with the systems/products/services.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure comprehensive mapping of data processing activities, detailing the specific data actions and elements involved in all systems, products, or services. This mapping should include identification of component owners/operators, and document interactions involving individuals or third parties. This process supports the organizational understanding necessary to manage privacy risks associated with data processing, aligning with the strategic objective to enhance privacy risk management through improved clarity on how data is processed within the organization.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization’s mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform privacy roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.
Framework Requirement Description: The organization’s role(s) in the data processing ecosystem are identified and communicated.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Identify and communicate the organization's specific roles within the data processing ecosystem to enhance the understanding of privacy risks associated with data processing, thereby supporting the prioritization of the organization’s mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities. This understanding is crucial for defining privacy roles, responsibilities, and informed risk management decisions.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization’s mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform privacy roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.
Framework Requirement Description: Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and communicate organizational priorities for the mission, objectives, and activities, ensuring alignment with privacy roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions to effectively manage privacy risks arising from data processing.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization’s mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform privacy roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.
Framework Requirement Description: Systems/products/services that support organizational priorities are identified and key requirements communicated.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Identify and communicate the key requirements of systems, products, or services that align with organizational priorities, ensuring these elements support the organization's mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities. This process aids in defining privacy roles, responsibilities, and informs risk management decisions related to data processing, thereby enhancing the management of privacy risks for individuals.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization understands the privacy risks to individuals and how such privacy risks may create follow-on impacts on organizational operations, including mission, functions, other risk management priorities (e.g., compliance, financial), reputation, workforce, and culture.
Framework Requirement Description: Contextual factors related to the systems/products/services and the data actions are identified (e.g., individuals’ demographics and privacy interests or perceptions, data sensitivity and/or types, visibility of data processing to individuals and third parties).
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Identify and analyze contextual factors such as individuals' demographics, privacy interests, data sensitivity, and visibility of data processing activities to enhance organizational understanding of privacy risks. This understanding is crucial for managing risks to individuals' privacy and addressing potential impacts on organizational operations, reputation, compliance, financial stability, workforce, and culture.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization understands the privacy risks to individuals and how such privacy risks may create follow-on impacts on organizational operations, including mission, functions, other risk management priorities (e.g., compliance, financial), reputation, workforce, and culture.
Framework Requirement Description: Data analytic inputs and outputs are identified and evaluated for bias.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure the identification and evaluation of biases in data analytics inputs and outputs to manage privacy risks for individuals arising from data processing, thereby understanding and addressing the potential impacts on organizational operations, reputation, and compliance obligations.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization understands the privacy risks to individuals and how such privacy risks may create follow-on impacts on organizational operations, including mission, functions, other risk management priorities (e.g., compliance, financial), reputation, workforce, and culture.
Framework Requirement Description: Potential problematic data actions and associated problems are identified.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Identify and document potential problematic data actions and the associated privacy risks to individuals, ensuring an understanding of how these risks may impact organizational operations, including compliance with mission-critical functions, financial obligations, reputation, workforce, and cultural values.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization understands the privacy risks to individuals and how such privacy risks may create follow-on impacts on organizational operations, including mission, functions, other risk management priorities (e.g., compliance, financial), reputation, workforce, and culture.
Framework Requirement Description: Problematic data actions, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine and prioritize risk.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des:
**Contextualized Framework Requirement:**

Develop and enhance the organizational understanding of privacy risks associated with data processing activities by identifying and evaluating problematic data actions, their likelihoods, and potential impacts. This understanding should inform the prioritization of privacy risk management efforts, ensuring alignment with organizational operations, mission, functions, compliance obligations, financial stability, reputation, workforce integrity, and cultural values.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization understands the privacy risks to individuals and how such privacy risks may create follow-on impacts on organizational operations, including mission, functions, other risk management priorities (e.g., compliance, financial), reputation, workforce, and culture.
Framework Requirement Description: Risk responses are identified, prioritized, and implemented.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Develop and implement prioritized risk responses to manage privacy risks to individuals from data processing, enhancing organizational understanding and addressing potential impacts on operations, compliance, financial stability, reputation, workforce, and culture.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing privacy risk and third parties within the data processing ecosystem. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess, and manage privacy risks within the data processing ecosystem.
Framework Requirement Description: Data processing ecosystem risk management policies, processes, and procedures are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and implement comprehensive risk management policies, processes, and procedures for the data processing ecosystem, ensuring alignment with organizational priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions. These must be collaboratively developed, regularly assessed, and agreed upon by relevant stakeholders to effectively manage privacy risks and maintain compliance within the data processing ecosystem.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing privacy risk and third parties within the data processing ecosystem. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess, and manage privacy risks within the data processing ecosystem.
Framework Requirement Description: Data processing ecosystem parties (e.g., service providers, customers, partners, product manufacturers, application developers) are identified, prioritized, and assessed using a privacy risk assessment process.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Identify, prioritize, and assess data processing ecosystem parties—including service providers, customers, partners, product manufacturers, and application developers—through a comprehensive privacy risk assessment process. This process is integral to developing the organizational understanding necessary to manage privacy risks to individuals arising from data processing activities. It supports the establishment of organizational priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions, facilitating informed risk decisions and effective management of privacy risks and third-party interactions within the data processing ecosystem.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing privacy risk and third parties within the data processing ecosystem. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess, and manage privacy risks within the data processing ecosystem.
Framework Requirement Description: Contracts with data processing ecosystem parties are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organization’s privacy program.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Contracts with data processing ecosystem parties are established to implement measures that align with the organization’s privacy program objectives, supporting the management of privacy risks for individuals arising from data processing. This is in accordance with the organization’s established priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions, and involves processes to identify, assess, and manage privacy risks within the data processing ecosystem.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing privacy risk and third parties within the data processing ecosystem. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess, and manage privacy risks within the data processing ecosystem.
Framework Requirement Description: Interoperability frameworks or similar multi-party approaches are used to manage data processing ecosystem privacy risks.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Utilize interoperability frameworks or equivalent multi-party approaches to enhance organizational understanding and management of privacy risks in the data processing ecosystem, ensuring alignment with established organizational priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions to effectively identify, assess, and manage privacy risks involving third parties.

Function Description: Develop the organizational understanding to manage privacy risk for individuals arising from data processing.
Category Description: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerance, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing privacy risk and third parties within the data processing ecosystem. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess, and manage privacy risks within the data processing ecosystem.
Framework Requirement Description: Data processing ecosystem parties are routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual, interoperability framework, or other obligations.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Regular assessments, through audits, testing, or evaluations, are conducted on all parties within the data processing ecosystem to ensure compliance with contractual, interoperability framework, or other obligations. This practice supports the organizational goal of managing privacy risks and aligns with established priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions to facilitate informed risk decisions regarding third-party interactions and privacy risk management within the data processing ecosystem.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Organizational privacy values and policies (e.g., conditions on data processing such as data uses or retention periods, individuals’ prerogatives with respect to data processing) are established and communicated.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and communicate organizational privacy values and policies, including conditions on data processing such as data uses or retention periods, and individuals’ prerogatives with respect to data processing, as part of the governance structure to enhance understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities and ensure compliance with regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements, thereby managing privacy risk effectively.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Processes to instill organizational privacy values within system/product/service development and operations are established and in place.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain processes that integrate organizational privacy values into the development and operational practices of systems, products, and services, ensuring these processes align with the organization's governance structure to manage privacy risks effectively and meet regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Roles and responsibilities for the workforce are established with respect to privacy.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and delineate roles and responsibilities for the workforce to ensure ongoing alignment with the organizational governance structure, thereby supporting the management of privacy risks in accordance with regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Privacy roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with third-party stakeholders (e.g., service providers, customers, partners).
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure the alignment and coordination of privacy roles and responsibilities with third-party stakeholders, such as service providers, customers, and partners, to support the organizational governance structure. This alignment aids in the ongoing understanding and management of the organization’s privacy risk, in accordance with its regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding privacy are understood and managed.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Develop and implement organizational governance structures that ensure a comprehensive understanding and management of legal, regulatory, and contractual privacy requirements, thereby informing and prioritizing the organization's privacy risk management strategies within the context of its broader regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational obligations.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Governance and risk management policies, processes, and procedures address privacy risks.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Develop and implement governance and risk management policies, processes, and procedures that address privacy risks within the organizational governance structure. This structure should enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities, which are informed by privacy risk, and ensure compliance with regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support operational risk decisions.
Framework Requirement Description: Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain risk management processes that are acknowledged and implemented by organizational stakeholders, ensuring these processes align with the organization's established priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions to support informed operational risk decisions, thereby facilitating an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities influenced by privacy risk.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support operational risk decisions.
Framework Requirement Description: Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and articulate the organization's risk tolerance within the governance structure to enhance the ongoing understanding and management of privacy risks, aligning with organizational priorities and supporting informed operational risk decisions.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support operational risk decisions.
Framework Requirement Description: The organization’s determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role(s) in the data processing ecosystem.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: The organization must establish and implement a governance structure that continuously informs its risk management priorities based on its defined roles within the data processing ecosystem, ensuring that these priorities reflect established constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions to support operational risk decisions.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The organization’s workforce and third parties engaged in data processing are provided privacy awareness education and are trained to perform their privacy-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements and organizational privacy values.
Framework Requirement Description: The workforce is informed and trained on its roles and responsibilities.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure the workforce is adequately informed and trained on their specific roles and responsibilities related to privacy, aligning with the organization's governance structure to enhance ongoing understanding of privacy risk management priorities. This training should be consistent with organizational privacy policies, processes, procedures, and values, and extend to third parties involved in data processing.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The organization’s workforce and third parties engaged in data processing are provided privacy awareness education and are trained to perform their privacy-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements and organizational privacy values.
Framework Requirement Description: Senior executives understand their roles and responsibilities.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Senior executives are educated and aware of their specific roles and responsibilities within the organizational governance structure to support ongoing privacy risk management priorities, aligning with the organization’s privacy values and regulatory requirements. This education is part of broader privacy awareness training provided to the workforce and third parties involved in data processing, ensuring compliance with privacy policies, processes, procedures, and agreements.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The organization’s workforce and third parties engaged in data processing are provided privacy awareness education and are trained to perform their privacy-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements and organizational privacy values.
Framework Requirement Description: Privacy personnel understand their roles and responsibilities.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure privacy personnel are aware of and understand their specific roles and responsibilities as part of the organizational governance structure, to support an ongoing alignment with the organization’s privacy risk management priorities. This understanding is crucial for implementing policies, processes, and procedures that uphold the organization's privacy values and comply with relevant agreements, particularly during engagements involving data processing by the workforce and third parties.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The organization’s workforce and third parties engaged in data processing are provided privacy awareness education and are trained to perform their privacy-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements and organizational privacy values.
Framework Requirement Description: Third parties (e.g., service providers, customers, partners) understand their roles and responsibilities.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure that all third parties, including service providers, customers, and partners, are clearly informed and understand their specific roles and responsibilities in relation to the organization's privacy policies and procedures. This understanding is crucial to uphold the organizational governance structure that supports ongoing awareness and adherence to the organization’s privacy risk management priorities. Additionally, it aligns with the requirement to provide privacy awareness education and training to those engaged in data processing, ensuring they can effectively fulfill their privacy-related duties in accordance with organizational privacy values and regulatory expectations.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Privacy risk is re-evaluated on an ongoing basis and as key factors, including the organization’s business environment (e.g., introduction of new technologies), governance (e.g., legal obligations, risk tolerance), data processing, and systems/products/services change.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Continuously re-evaluate privacy risks in response to changes in the business environment, governance, data processing, and systems/products/services to maintain an up-to-date understanding of the organization's privacy posture, thereby informing and guiding the management of privacy risk in alignment with the organization's risk management priorities.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Privacy values, policies, and training are reviewed and any updates are communicated.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure the organization's privacy values, policies, and training are periodically reviewed and updated as necessary, with all amendments effectively communicated across the organization. This process supports the governance structure that facilitates an ongoing understanding and management of privacy risks, aligning with organizational risk management priorities.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Policies, processes, and procedures for assessing compliance with legal requirements and privacy policies are established and in place.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain policies, processes, and procedures to assess compliance with legal and internal privacy requirements, ensuring these measures are integrated within the organizational governance structure to continually inform and align with the organization’s privacy risk management priorities.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Policies, processes, and procedures for communicating progress on managing privacy risks are established and in place.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain policies, processes, and procedures to effectively communicate the organization's progress in managing privacy risks, ensuring these measures are aligned with the organizational governance structure to continuously inform and update the organization’s privacy risk management priorities.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Policies, processes, and procedures are established and in place to receive, analyze, and respond to problematic data actions disclosed to the organization from internal and external sources (e.g., internal discovery, privacy researchers, professional events).
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain policies, processes, and procedures to effectively receive, analyze, and address problematic data actions reported by both internal and external sources, such as through internal audits, inputs from privacy researchers, or insights gained at professional events. This practice supports the organizational governance structure by enhancing the ongoing understanding and management of privacy risks, aligning with the organization's risk management priorities.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Policies, processes, and procedures incorporate lessons learned from problematic data actions.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Develop and implement organizational policies, processes, and procedures that integrate lessons learned from problematic data actions, ensuring continuous improvement in privacy management and alignment with the organization's risk management priorities.

Function Description: Develop and implement the organizational governance structure to enable an ongoing understanding of the organization’s risk management priorities that are informed by privacy risk.
Category Description: The policies, processes, and procedures for ongoing review of the organization’s privacy posture are understood and inform the management of privacy risk.
Framework Requirement Description: Policies, processes, and procedures for receiving, tracking, and responding to complaints, concerns, and questions from individuals about organizational privacy practices are established and in place.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain policies, processes, and procedures to effectively manage complaints, concerns, and inquiries from individuals regarding the organization's privacy practices, ensuring these mechanisms are integral to the organizational governance structure. This will support an ongoing understanding and management of privacy risks, aligning with the organization’s risk management priorities.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Code: Data Processing Policies, Processes, and Procedures (CT.PO-P)
Category Description: Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage data processing (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Framework Requirement Description: Policies, processes, and procedures for authorizing data processing (e.g., organizational decisions, individual consent), revoking authorizations, and maintaining authorizations are established and in place.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain comprehensive policies, processes, and procedures to manage authorizations for data processing activities, including granting, revoking, and maintaining authorizations, aligned with organizational decisions or individual consent. These should be consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect privacy, clearly defining the purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, and management commitment within the data processing ecosystem. This approach supports the management of privacy risks with the necessary granularity to address individual and organizational needs.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Code: Data Processing Policies, Processes, and Procedures (CT.PO-P)
Category Description: Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage data processing (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Framework Requirement Description: Policies, processes, and procedures for enabling data review, transfer, sharing or disclosure, alteration, and deletion are established and in place (e.g., to maintain data quality, manage data retention).
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain comprehensive policies, processes, and procedures that enable precise management of data review, transfer, sharing, disclosure, alteration, and deletion to uphold data quality and adhere to data retention policies. These practices should align with the organization's risk strategy to protect privacy and define clear purpose, scope, roles, and responsibilities within the data processing ecosystem, ensuring management commitment to privacy risk management.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Code: Data Processing Policies, Processes, and Procedures (CT.PO-P)
Category Description: Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage data processing (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Framework Requirement Description: Policies, processes, and procedures for enabling individuals’ data processing preferences and requests are established and in place.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain policies, processes, and procedures that enable the management of individuals' data processing preferences and requests, ensuring alignment with the organization's privacy risk strategy and management commitment. This should include defining the purpose, scope, roles, and responsibilities within the data processing ecosystem to support granular data management and protect individuals' privacy.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Code: Data Processing Policies, Processes, and Procedures (CT.PO-P)
Category Description: Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage data processing (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Framework Requirement Description: A data life cycle to manage data is aligned and implemented with the system development life cycle to manage systems.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Develop and implement data management policies, processes, and procedures that align the data life cycle with the system development life cycle, ensuring management of systems and data with granularity sufficient to address privacy risks, in accordance with organizational risk strategies and commitments to protect individual privacy.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: Data elements can be accessed for review.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure that data elements are accessible for review to support the organization's activities in managing data with the granularity necessary for effective privacy risk management, aligning with the organization's risk strategy to protect individual privacy, enhance manageability, and facilitate the implementation of key privacy principles such as individual participation, data quality, and data minimization.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: Data elements can be accessed for transmission or disclosure.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure that data elements are accessible for transmission or disclosure in a manner that aligns with the organization's risk strategy to protect individual privacy, enhance manageability, and support the implementation of core privacy principles such as individual participation, data quality, and data minimization, thereby enabling organizations or individuals to manage data with the granularity necessary to address privacy risks effectively.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: Data elements can be accessed for alteration.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure that data elements are accessible for modification to support the organization's ability to manage data with the granularity necessary for mitigating privacy risks, aligning with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individual privacy, enhance manageability, and facilitate the adherence to privacy principles such as individual participation, data quality, and data minimization.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: Mechanisms for transmitting processing permissions and related data values with data elements are established and in place.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain mechanisms that ensure the transmission and processing of permissions and associated data values alongside data elements, to support the management of data in alignment with the organization's risk strategy. This facilitates the protection of individual privacy, enhances manageability, and supports the implementation of core privacy principles such as individual participation, data quality, and data minimization.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: Audit/log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy and incorporating the principle of data minimization.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure audit and log records are established, documented, implemented, and periodically reviewed in alignment with organizational policies, emphasizing the principle of data minimization to manage data with the granularity necessary for effective privacy risk management, thereby supporting the organization's broader risk strategy and reinforcing adherence to core privacy principles such as individual participation, data quality, and data minimization.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: Technical measures implemented to manage data processing are tested and assessed.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Implement and assess technical measures for data processing to ensure they align with the organization's privacy risk strategy, thereby supporting the management of data in a way that respects privacy principles such as individual participation, data quality, and data minimization.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy, increase manageability, and enable the implementation of privacy principles (e.g., individual participation, data quality, data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: Stakeholder privacy preferences are included in algorithmic design objectives and outputs are evaluated against these preferences.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Incorporate stakeholder privacy preferences into the design objectives of algorithms and evaluate the outputs to ensure alignment with these preferences, as part of the organization's activities to manage data with granularity that addresses privacy risks effectively. This practice supports the organization's broader risk strategy to safeguard individual privacy, enhance data manageability, and uphold key privacy principles such as individual participation, data quality, and data minimization.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data processing solutions increase disassociability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and enable implementation of privacy principles (e.g., data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: Data are processed to limit observability and linkability (e.g., data actions take place on local devices, privacy-preserving cryptography).
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Implement data processing solutions that enhance disassociability by limiting observability and linkability of data, such as conducting data actions on local devices and employing privacy-preserving cryptography, aligned with the organization's risk strategy to protect individuals' privacy and support the implementation of privacy principles like data minimization.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data processing solutions increase disassociability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and enable implementation of privacy principles (e.g., data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: Data are processed to limit the identification of individuals (e.g., de-identification privacy techniques, tokenization).
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Implement data processing solutions such as de-identification and tokenization to enhance the disassociability of personal data, aligning with the organization's risk strategy for privacy protection and supporting the implementation of privacy principles like data minimization. This is to manage privacy risks effectively while maintaining the ability to manage data with the granularity necessary for organizational or individual privacy management.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data processing solutions increase disassociability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and enable implementation of privacy principles (e.g., data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: Data are processed to limit the formulation of inferences about individuals’ behavior or activities (e.g., data processing is decentralized, distributed architectures).
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Develop and implement data processing solutions that limit the formulation of inferences about individuals' behavior or activities by employing methods such as decentralization and distributed architectures. This approach should align with the organization's risk strategy to enhance disassociability, supporting the protection of individuals' privacy and the implementation of privacy principles like data minimization.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data processing solutions increase disassociability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and enable implementation of privacy principles (e.g., data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: System or device configurations permit selective collection or disclosure of data elements.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Develop and implement system or device configurations that allow for the selective collection or disclosure of data elements, enhancing disassociability in line with the organization's risk strategy to protect individuals' privacy. This supports the management of privacy risks with granular control over data, aligning with principles such as data minimization.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations or individuals to manage data with sufficient granularity to manage privacy risks.
Category Description: Data processing solutions increase disassociability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and enable implementation of privacy principles (e.g., data minimization).
Framework Requirement Description: Attribute references are substituted for attribute values.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Implement data processing solutions that substitute attribute references for attribute values, enhancing disassociability in line with the organization's risk strategy to support privacy principles such as data minimization, thereby enabling precise management of privacy risks at the necessary granularity.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Category Description: Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to increase transparency of the organization’s data processing practices (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) and associated privacy risks.
Framework Requirement Description: Transparency policies, processes, and procedures for communicating data processing purposes, practices, and associated privacy risks are established and in place.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain transparency policies, processes, and procedures that clearly communicate the purposes, practices, and privacy risks of data processing to enhance organizational and individual understanding, facilitating an informed dialogue about data management commitments and responsibilities within the data processing ecosystem.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Category Description: Policies, processes, and procedures are maintained and used to increase transparency of the organization’s data processing practices (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment) and associated privacy risks.
Framework Requirement Description: Roles and responsibilities (e.g., public relations) for communicating data processing purposes, practices, and associated privacy risks are established.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and delineate roles and responsibilities for communicating the purposes and practices of data processing, as well as the associated privacy risks, to enhance transparency and foster a reliable understanding among stakeholders, in alignment with organizational policies and commitments to privacy management.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Category Description: Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Framework Requirement Description: Mechanisms (e.g., notices, internal or public reports) for communicating data processing purposes, practices, associated privacy risks, and options for enabling individuals’ data processing preferences and requests are established and in place.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain mechanisms such as notices and reports to communicate data processing purposes, practices, associated privacy risks, and options for individuals to manage their data processing preferences and requests. This ensures that both organizations and individuals have a reliable understanding of data processing activities, enhancing predictability and alignment with the organization’s privacy risk strategy.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Category Description: Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.
Framework Requirement Description: Mechanisms for obtaining feedback from individuals (e.g., surveys or focus groups) about data processing and associated privacy risks are established and in place.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain mechanisms such as surveys or focus groups to gather feedback from individuals about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, ensuring reliable knowledge and dialogue consistent with the organization’s privacy risk strategy.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Category Description: Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Category Description: Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Category Description: Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.

Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure mechanisms are in place to communicate corrections or deletions of data to relevant individuals or organizations within the data processing ecosystem, enhancing transparency and predictability in data handling practices consistent with the organization’s privacy risk strategy, thereby supporting reliable understanding and dialogue about data processing and associated privacy risks.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Category Description: Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.

Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Maintain and ensure accessibility of data provenance and lineage to support a reliable understanding of data processing practices and privacy risks, thereby enhancing dialogue and predictability in alignment with the organization's privacy risk strategy.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Category Description: Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to enable organizations and individuals to have a reliable understanding and engage in a dialogue about how data are processed and associated privacy risks.
Category Description: Individuals and organizations have reliable knowledge about data processing practices and associated privacy risks, and effective mechanisms are used and maintained to increase predictability consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.

This supports the objective of fostering a reliable understanding and dialogue about data processing, aligning with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Category Code: Data Protection Policies, Processes, and Procedures (PR.PO-P)
Category Description: Security and privacy policies (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment), processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage the protection of data.
Framework Requirement Description: A baseline configuration of information technology is created and maintained incorporating security principles (e.g., concept of least functionality).
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain a baseline configuration of information technology systems that integrates security principles, such as the concept of least functionality, to support the development and implementation of appropriate data processing safeguards. This is aligned with the security and privacy policies, processes, and procedures designed to manage the protection of data within the organization.

Category Description: Security and privacy policies (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment), processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage the protection of data.
Framework Requirement Description: Configuration change control processes are established and in place.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Establish and maintain configuration change control processes to manage the protection of data, ensuring these processes are aligned with security and privacy policies, and support the development and implementation of appropriate data processing safeguards.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Category Code: Data Protection Policies, Processes, and Procedures (PR.PO-P)
Category Description: Security and privacy policies (e.g., purpose, scope, roles and responsibilities in the data processing ecosystem, and management commitment), processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage the protection of data.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Category Code: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AC-P)
Category Description: Access to data and devices is limited to authorized individuals, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access.
Framework Requirement Description: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized individuals, processes, and devices.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure the issuance, management, verification, revocation, and auditing of identities and credentials for all authorized individuals, processes, and devices to limit access to data and devices consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access, thereby supporting the development and implementation of appropriate data processing safeguards.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Category Code: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AC-P)
Category Description: Access to data and devices is limited to authorized individuals, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access.
Framework Requirement Description: Physical access to data and devices is managed.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure physical access to data and devices is restricted and managed to limit access to authorized individuals, processes, and devices, in alignment with the assessed risk of unauthorized access, as part of developing and implementing appropriate data processing safeguards.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Category Code: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AC-P)
Category Description: Access to data and devices is limited to authorized individuals, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access.
Framework Requirement Description: Remote access is managed.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure that remote access to data and devices is restricted and controlled based on authorization levels and assessed risks to prevent unauthorized access, in alignment with the objective to develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Category Code: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AC-P)
Category Description: Access to data and devices is limited to authorized individuals, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access.
Framework Requirement Description: Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Implement management of access permissions and authorizations by applying the principles of least privilege and separation of duties to limit access to data and devices to authorized individuals, processes, and devices, in alignment with the assessed risk of unauthorized access, as part of developing and implementing appropriate data processing safeguards.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Category Code: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AC-P)
Category Description: Access to data and devices is limited to authorized individuals, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access.
Framework Requirement Description: Network integrity is protected (e.g., network segregation, network segmentation).
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure network integrity by implementing network segregation and segmentation to limit access to data and devices to authorized individuals, processes, and devices, thereby managing the risk of unauthorized access as part of developing and implementing appropriate data processing safeguards.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Category Code: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control (PR.AC-P)
Category Description: Access to data and devices is limited to authorized individuals, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access.
Framework Requirement Description: Individuals and devices are proofed and bound to credentials, and authenticated commensurate with the risk of the transaction (e.g., individuals’ security and privacy risks and other organizational risks).
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure that individuals and devices are rigorously proofed and securely bound to credentials, with authentication levels tailored to match the risk associated with the transaction. This includes evaluating the security and privacy risks to individuals, as well as other organizational risks, to develop and implement robust data processing safeguards. Access to data and devices must be strictly limited to authorized individuals, processes, and devices, managed in accordance with the assessed risk of unauthorized access.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Category Description: Data are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect individuals’ privacy and maintain data confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Category Description: Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems/products/services and associated data, consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements.

Category Description: Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems/products/services and associated data, consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements.
Framework Requirement Description: Communications and control networks are protected.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Ensure that communications and control networks are secured to maintain the integrity and resilience of systems, products, and services, as well as the protection of associated data, in alignment with organizational policies, processes, procedures, and agreements, thereby supporting the development and implementation of necessary data processing safeguards.

Function Description: Develop and implement appropriate data processing safeguards.
Category Description: Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems/products/services and associated data, consistent with related policies, processes, procedures, and agreements.
Framework Requirement Description: Mechanisms (e.g., failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations.
Contextualized Framework Requirement Des: Implement mechanisms such as failsafe, load balancing, and hot swap to ensure the resilience of systems, products, and services in both normal and adverse situations, thereby upholding the security and resilience of associated data in alignment with relevant policies, processes, procedures, and agreements.
